earnings.translation[0].definitions[0].d: the money that you receive for the work that you do
earnings.translation[0].definitions[0].e: He claimed compensation for loss of earnings.
earnings.translation[0].definitions[1].d: the profit that a company or country makes
earnings.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The company’s earnings have dropped by 5% in the first quarter.
Oil provides 40% of Norway’s export earnings.
earnings.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: Average earnings for teachers are around $70,000.
Some football players have weekly earnings of over £50,000.
Professional people pay more tax, because of their higher earnings.
a new government policy which is designed to help people on low earnings
His annual earnings are over £1 million.
With serious injuries, the court may award substantial damages for loss of future earnings.
The bank will announce its quarterly earnings on January 17.
The company’s fourth quarter earnings are excellent.
You can usually borrow up to three times the value of your gross earnings per year.
The company’s net earnings have fallen over the last two years.
Export earnings from oil bring valuable overseas currency into the country.
Average earnings increased by 5 per cent last year.
The company’s earnings fell by 21% in the fourth quarter.
Many car manufacturers have reported disappointing earnings this year.
He found he was having to work harder just to maintain his level of earnings.
The insurance policy covers you for loss of earnings due to illness.
The first part of this year has seen a substantial growth in earnings.
earnings.translation[1].definitions[0].d: the money that a person receives for the work they do in a particular period of time
earnings.translation[1].definitions[0].e: He always thought he’d be satisfied even if his earnings didn’t reach $20,000 a year.
the gap between the gross earnings (=income before tax) of manual and non-manual workers
earnings.translation[1].definitions[1].d: the total amount that people receive for the work they do in a particular industry or economy in a particular period of time
earnings.translation[1].definitions[1].e: This month’s figures on inflation, industrial production, average earnings (=the average amount that people earn) and unemployment are expected to show continuing economic weakness.
earnings.translation[1].definitions[2].d: the profit that a company makes in a particular period of time, or the total profits that companies make in a particular industry or economy in a particular period of time
earnings.translation[1].definitions[2].e: British Airways counts on North Atlantic flights for about half its earnings.
This year, the steel industry’s earnings should be higher with the completion of costly modernization programs.
Few can match Quality’s earnings growth of 40% per year over the past five years.
earnings.translation[1].definitions[3].d: an investor buys earnings growth by buying shares that are quite cheap in relation to the amount of profit the company made in the previous year, hoping that the value of the shares will increase
earnings.translation[1].definitions[3].e: The company could buy earnings growth for its shareholders by buying ports overseas with its excess capital.
